intro: Sphaeralcea angustifolia subsp. cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This subspecies is often found in plains and foothills, where it thrives in full sun.
